---
title: 'init'
description: "Create a new project from a template"
---

Create a new Xorq project from a template. Use this to bootstrap a script, config, and structure for cached data fetching or ML workflows.

## Usage

Run from the directory where you want the project created.

```bash
xorq init [OPTIONS]
```

## Options

These flags control where and which template is used.

| Option | Short | Default | Description |
|--------|-------|---------|-------------|
| `--path` | `-p` | `./xorq-template` | Directory where the template is created |
| `--template` | `-t` | `cached-fetcher` | Template type |
| `--branch` | `-b` | (template default) | Git branch or commit to use for the template |

## Templates

Available template types and what they include.

| Template | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `cached-fetcher` | Cached data fetching workflows (default) |
| `sklearn` | Machine learning workflows with scikit-learn |
| `penguins` | Example using the penguins dataset |

## Examples

Common ways to run the command.

Default template in the default directory:

```bash
xorq init
```

Custom directory and template:

```bash
xorq init --path ./my-project --template sklearn
```

## Output

After running the command, the directory is created and a line is printed to stdout:

```
initialized xorq template `{template}` to {path}
```
